main

Class ClackServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.ClackServer

  • public class ClackServer
extends java.lang.Object
    ClackServer contains the information about the port that the clients connect to and the data being sent to and received from the clients. The clients are stored inside an ArrayList in the form of ServerSideClientIO objects. It also contains a boolean value closeConnection which says if the server needs to be closed or not
    Author:
    Aengus Andrew

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClackServer()
      ClackServer() is the default constructor for this class The default constructor calls the main constructor with the default port 7000
      ClackServer(int port)
      ClackServer(int port) is the main constructor for this class The main constructor takes a single integer port as argument and sets the port number to this value, then sets the data to be sent and received to null

      hashCode() is overridden from the Object class and creates a unique integer for this ClackServer object
      java.lang.String listusers()
      listusers() returns a string with all the userNames of clients connected to the server delimited by newline characters
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method is used for testing

      remove() removes the passed ServerSideClientIO object from the serverSideClientIOList

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        start() initializes the Server to accept Clients and then accepts them. When it accepts a client it adds their data to a ServerSideCLientIO object and adds that to an ArrayList. It also starts a thread for each client.

      • remove

        public void remove(ServerSideClientIO ssc)
        remove() removes the passed ServerSideClientIO object from the serverSideClientIOList
        Parameters:
        ssc - ServerSideClientIO object to remove

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(ClackData dataToBroadcastToClient)
        broadcast() loops through all clients currently connected to the server and sends the appropriate data to each of them.
        Parameters:
        dataToBroadcastToClient - data to be sent to all clients connected to the server

        Returns the current value of port for the class
